title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. — On a night where offensive fireworks were expected, the Charlotte Hornets authored a masterpiece of defensive grit, grounding the high-flying Los Angeles Lakers for a commanding 88-78 victory in 1997.

From the opening tip, the Hornets established a physical, disruptive tone. The Lakers, visibly frustrated, were held to a mere 78 points, a stunning figure for a team of their caliber. The story of the game was not a singular scoring outburst, but a collective defensive chokehold applied by the home team.

Charlotte’s dominance was built on the glass, where they outmuscled the Lakers. This relentless effort on the boards limited Los Angeles to one-and-done possessions and fueled the Hornets' own offensive flow.

While the Lakers' stars struggled to find any rhythm against the swarming defense, the Hornets showcased a balanced and efficient attack. Their ball movement was crisp, leading to high-percentage looks that stood in stark contrast to the forced attempts from Los Angeles.

Ultimately, this was a statement win for Charlotte. It was a victory forged not by a singular superstar, but by a unified commitment to a defensive identity. They proved that on any given night, a suffocating defense can silence even the most potent of opponents, leaving the Lakers to search for answers after a performance that was simply smothered.
